III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
1

background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was mocked by Staff 1 due to his speech impediment.
Staff 1 used derogatory remarks towards his family. This was
done in front of his peers.
Investigation Interviews:
The following interviews were conducted face to face at the
facility on 9/8/25:
Complainant reported this information was shared via grievances
filed by Youth A and Youth B. No additional information was
shared.
Supervisor reported she supervises Staff 1. Supervisor reported
she has never had any issues with Staff 1. Staff 1 is stern and
structured. Supervisor reported Youth A and Youth B both wrote
grievances pertaining to Staff 1. These grievances were written
right after Youth A was consequenced by Staff 1 for his behaviors
on 8/27/25.
Youth C reported Staff 1 is a “cool staff”, but she also “says stuff
to people.” Youth C reported this meant she states comments that
are sometimes mean and puts the youth down. Youth C reported
she has told youth not to get their hopes up for their court hearing
because they are not coming home. Youth C reported she has
told the group the females in the building fight better than they do.
Youth C reported she mocked Youth A once by mimicking his
stutter. Youth C reported Youth A stutters at times and one time
after Youth A stutter, she responded with stuttering in a mocking
manner. Youth C reported he only heard this one time. Youth C
reported he has never heard Staff 1 call anyone’s mother a “bitch”,
or that their “mother should have swallowed.”
Youth D reported he does not get along with Staff 1. Youth D
reported he sometimes speaks with a lisp due to his braces and
she has mocked him for that. Youth D reported she will tell other
youth that they are not going home when they have upcoming
court dates. Youth D reported this is not in a gentle or
encouraging way. Youth D reported Youth A was upset with her
during a conversation concerning a fight he had been in. Youth D
reported he wasn’t sure what the conversation was about, but
Youth A got upset and she sent him to the “back hall” to
2

deescalate. Staff 1 then said, “What the fuck? I wasn’t even
talking to him.” Youth D reported he has never heard her call
anyone’s mother a “bitch” or that their “mother should have
swallowed.” Youth D reported he never heard her mock Youth A’s
stutter.
Youth E reported he does not get along with Staff 1. Youth E
reported she is too strict. Youth E reported she made fun of Youth
F once and told him that his mother should have swallowed. Youth
E reported Youth F was acting out and called her a “bitch” and she
responded with those comments. Youth E was not able to
elaborate on what that comment meant. Youth E reported she has
told youth they are not going home. Youth E reported he hasn’t
heard Staff 1 make fun of anyone else. Youth E reported he has
not heard Staff 1 call anyone’s’ mother a “bitch”.
Youth F reported he has not heard Staff 1 say anything to youth
that was inappropriate. This includes, mocking youth, calling their
mother a “bitch”, or making fun of them. Youth F reported had an
issue with her once. Youth F reported he was in his room for
bedtime, and he was upset with her, but this doesn’t bother him
anymore. Youth F would not elaborate on what it was that
bothered him about that incident. Youth F denied Staff 1 stated to
him that “his mother should have swallowed.”
Youth A reported Staff 1 threatens to send the youth to the back
hall for everything. Youth A reported he stutters sometimes, and
Staff 1 has mocked him by stuttering back to him. Youth A
reported this is when he wrote his grievance concerning Staff 1.
Youth A reported he was in a physical altercation with another
youth. Staff 1 was not there but was in the control room and saw
it. When Staff 1 supervised the youth after the altercation, she
made a comment that the girls fight better than the boys. She put
her head down and pretended to fight by swinging her arms.
Youth A reported she was making fun of how he fights and was
adamant that was not how he fights. Youth A reported he went to
say something after she did this, and he stuttered. She responded
with stuttering back at him. He got upset and vocalized this. Staff
1 sent him to the back hall for a consequence. Youth A reported
Staff 1 speaks inappropriate about other staff. Youth A reported
Staff 1 will state that other staff don’t know what they are doing
and that she is the Pod Boss, basically stating she runs this pod,
and no one else does. Youth A reported she complains about the
newer staff. Youth A reported he has never heard Staff 1 call
anyone’s mother a “bitch” or state that their “mother should have
swallowed.”
3

Youth B reported you cannot speak to Staff 1 by asking questions
or she will consequence you. Youth A reported Staff 1 will tell
others that they are not going home. Youth B reported he wrote a
grievance after he attempted to talk to Staff 1 about how he feels
she treats everyone. Youth B reported she laughed at him and
told him, “You are a resident, you don’t get to tell me what to do.”
Youth B reported Staff 1 stated a comment about the way the
boys fight. Youth B reported she stated, “I saw you boys scraping
like you were little girls.” Youth B reported she started swinging
her arms and fighting to demonstrate what they looked like. Youth
B reported Youth A had just got into a fight, so it appeared to be
about him. Youth B reported Youth A got upset and used profanity
and Staff 1 stated back, “That’s the ugliest boy I ever fucking
saw.” Youth B reported everyone laughed. Youth B reported Staff
1 complains about other staff not knowing how to do their job.
Youth B reported Staff 1 will go too far when she is joking. Youth
B reported Youth G that walks a little funny and Staff 1 has stated,
“He looks like he shit himself.” Youth B reported he has never
heard her call someone’s mother a “bitch” or that their “mother
should have swallowed.”
The following interviews were conducted face to face at the
facility on 9/8/25 with a union representative present.
Staff 2 reported he has worked with Staff 1 for about three
months. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 is strict and stern. Staff 2 reported
he has never heard Staff 1 use profanity or call anyone girls or
that they fight like girls. Staff 2 reported he has bever heard her
call someone’s mother a “bitch” or that that their “mother should
have swallowed”. Staff 2 reported he has never seen her
unprofessional.
Staff 3 reported he has never heard Staff 1 use profanity, mock
youth, or be unprofessional with youth. Staff 3 reported she is
strict and straightforward, open to conversations and engages
lightly with joking.
Staff 1 reported she was in the control room on 8/27/25 when she
watched Youth A get into a physical altercation with another
youth. Staff 1 reported she worked in the unit with Youth A the
following day. They were in line getting ready to leave the unit.
Staff 1 reported that a code was called for extra staff to help in the
girl’s unit. This meant there was a fight or restraint with the girls.
Staff 1 reported one of the boys in the unit stated, “those girls
can’t fight.” Staff 1 reported she said, “ya’ll boys can’t fight either.”
4

Staff 1 reported she wailed her arms to show them they couldn’t
fight either. Staff 1 reported Youth A then got upset and told her to
stop playing with him. Staff 1 reported her comment was not
meant specifically towards him and she responded to him that she
didn’t know what he was talking about. Youth A became
disrespectful and left the back of the line and started to walk
towards her in the front of the line. Staff 1 reported he needed to
get it together or he can go to the back hall. Staff 1 reported he
went to the back hall and the next day Youth A apologized to her.
Staff 1 reported she has never made fun of Youth A’s stuttering,
never uses profanity, never called anyone’s mother a “bitch” nor
said that their “mother should have swallowed”. Staff 1 reported
she has never stated that a youth walks like he has feces in his
pants. Staff 1 reported Youth G has gas and she told him to go in
the bathroom and take care of it.
Staff 4 reported he has never heard Staff 1 use profanity towards
the youth, but Staff 1 has used profanity in her words with youth.
Staff 4 reported Staff 1 is strict, and staff and youth cannot really
say anything to alter the schedule for the day. Both staff and youth
walk on eggshells around her. Staff 4 reported he has not heard
Staff 1 make fun of Youth A’s stutter. Staff 4 reported she will talk
about other staff in front of the youth. Staff 4 reported he did not
hear Staff 1 say to Youth F that his “mother should have
swallowed,” but knew Staff 1 upset him. Youth F and the rest of
the youth were in their beds for nighttime. Staff 1 completed the
observation of the youth, and he heard banging on the door.
When she came back, he went to check on Youth F and he stated
she had said those words to him. Staff 4 reported Staff 1 is not
encouraging to the youth. Staff 1 will state to the youth that they
are coming back from their court hearings when the youth make
comments that they might go home after court. Staff 4 reported
the way that she says it is not to be truthful to them, so that they
don’t have the wrong expectations. Staff 4 reported it is said in a
way that means even if you don’t come back, you will be back one
day. Staff 4 reported she does not encourage the youth. Staff 4
reported she tends to pick the wrong battles. Staff 4 reported Staff
1 states she is the “Pod Boss.” Staff 4 reported she has made fun
of a youth for walking differently. Staff 4 reported the other youth
heard.
Staff 5 reported he works with Staff 1 weekly. Staff 5 reported she
works with kids well but does raise her voice and is stern with
them. Staff 5 reported he heard her complain about staff in front of
the youth. Staff 5 reported he heard her state comments about a
Youth G that walks a little differently in front of the other youth.
5

Staff 5 reported the other kids laughed. Staff 5 reported he was
there when Staff 1 made fun of Youth 5 for his fighting ability. Staff
5 reported a youth stated a comment about the girl’s fighting and
Staff 1 stated, “they know how to fight, not like you guys.” Staff 5
reported she started moving her hands around mocking their
fighting ability. Staff 5 reported he was unsure if it was directly
targeted at Youth A, but Youth A was the only one who had been
in a physical altercation with the last week or so. Staff 5 reported
heard Staff 1 mock Youth A’s stutter.
Staff 6 reported he has never heard Staff 1 use profanity with the
youth or go outside of any policies and procedures.
I attempted to contact Youth G on 10/20/25 and 10/23/25 via
telephone. Youth G is no longer in the program. There was no
answer.
Additional Findings:
In the course of the investigation, Youth H wrote a grievance
concerning Staff 3 reporting he spoke unprofessional to the
youth.
Staff 3 reported he has never spoken unprofessionally to Youth H.
Staff 3 reported he has never used profanity towards Youth H.
Staff 3 reported that he always has to redirect Youth H because
Youth H questions staff often.
Youth H was interviewed on 10/21/25. Youth H reported that he
was never spoken unprofessionally by Staff 2. Youth H reported
he wrote the grievance because he was upset and it was not true.
Staff 4 reported he has heard Staff 3 say, “Shut the fuck up,” to
the kids. Staff 4 reported it has been rare but if he is angry or
frustrated, he will state this. Staff 4 reported on 10/22/25 that he
may have asked Staff 3 if he needed to be switched out for a little
while. Staff 4 reported nothing continued so there was no reason
to report because the incident was taken care of.
Staff 6 reported he has heard Staff 3 say, “Shut the fuck up,” to
the kids. Staff 6 reported he sometimes brings his frustrations
from home to work, but overall, he is a good staff. Staff 6 reported
he did not tell anyone because the situation was handled and
diffused by talking to youth and staff. Staff 6 reported there were
no other incidents so they continued with their shift. Staff 6
reported if it rose to abuse or neglect he would report this, but felt
that it was taken care of.
6

Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1 personnel file. Staff 1’s central registry was dated
12/20/24, training was in compliance and did have topics
pertaining to communication and verbal de-escalation. Staff
1 did not have discipline in her file.
• Staff 3 personnel file. Staff 3’s central registry was
completed on 2/24/25. Staff completed all training required
which included, communication and verbal de-escalation.
Staff 3 has discipline in his file:
o 7/11/2019: Sleeping while on shift; one day
suspension without pay
o 10/5/2023: Improper conduct; Staff 3 used abusive
language and received a written reprimand
o 8/19/2024: Verbal or physical abuse; Staff name
called a resident and used an inappropriate racial
slur towards a youth.
• Grievances from Youth A, Youth B, and Youth H.
Grievances were in agreement with their interviews.
Analysis The agency is non-compliant with this rule. Staff and youth
reported Staff 1 has mocked youth by mimicking Youth A’s stutter,
making inappropriate comments concerning the boys fighting like
the girls, which resulted in the escalation of Youth A, and ridiculing
Youth G’s Walk. Staff 3 has, in frustration, told the youth to “shut
the fuck up.”
Technical Assistance:
Staff 3 had two other disciplinary actions pertaining to misconduct
and verbal abuse in his file within the last two years. The agency
will need to provide more than training to ensure Staff 3 does not
continue to supervise children in this manner. Additional
supervision, possible mentorship, specific employee goals,
training to aid in those goals and monitoring may be used to
provide further employee assistance.
Neither Staff 4 nor Staff 6 reported this information to their
supervisors. Both felt like they handled the situation at the time of
the incident. Currently there is not a policy that is directly related
to this. The agency will need to address this in a policy. It is the
responsibility of all staff to provide for the continual needs,
protection and supervision of residents. By not reporting this to the
supervisor on duty or direct supervisor, staff are unable to be
properly trained or corrected to conform to the milieu of the
agency.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
